decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly getting creatures onto the battlefield and using cheap, efficient spells to control the opponent's board and deal damage quickly. It utilizes cards like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Lightning Bolt to apply early pressure while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Daze and Stifle. The deck also includes strong card draw and selection in Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe, as well as powerful counter magic in Force of Will. The mana base is streamlined to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on using land manipulation and control to outmaneuver the opponent and lock down the game. It seeks to utilize cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful Marit Lage token, while also disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Rishadan Port. By controlling the board through land destruction and manipulation, the deck aims to grind out the opponent and secure victory through attrition. Additionally, it has tools like Punishing Fire and Life from the Loam for added control and recurring threats.

This Dragon Stompy deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption through mana denial and taxing effects. By using cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void, the deck aims to lock opponents out of casting their spells effectively while deploying threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Siege-Gang Commander to apply pressure. The deck also utilizes Imperial Recruiter and Moggcatcher to tutor for key creatures like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker for combo potential. With a mix of disruption and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by utilizing counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's plan and stabilize the board. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game with cards like Terminus, Swords to Plowshares, and Force of Will, while also generating card advantage through Brainstorm, Sensei's Divining Top, and Snapcaster Mage. The deck includes win conditions like Entreat the Angels and creatures such as Vendilion Clique and Jace, the Mind Sculptor to close out the game once control of the board has been established.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent while applying pressure with efficient creatures and burn spells. By using countermagic like Daze and Force of Will, along with disruption like Abrupt Decay and Deathrite Shaman, the deck aims to keep the opponent off balance while creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf chip away at their life total. The inclusion of card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Snapcaster Mage allows for consistent threat deployment and answers to the opponent's threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble an Infect creature, such as Blighted Agent or Glistener Elf, and pump it up with cards like Invigorate, Berserk, and Become Immense to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent. The deck includes mana acceleration in the form of Noble Hierarch and efficient interaction with Brainstorm, Daze, Force of Will, and Spell Pierce to protect the combo. Gitaxian Probe and Ponder provide card selection, while Sylvan Library helps with card advantage. Inkmoth Nexus offers an alternate win condition.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly ramp into powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Emrakul, and Worldspine Wurm using cards like Lotus Petal, Seething Song, and Simian Spirit Guide. Sneak Attack and Through the Breach allow for fast creature deployment, while Blood Moon disrupts opponent's mana bases. Chalice of the Void helps control the board, and Godo, Bandit Warlord can tutor for key equipment like Batterskull. City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb provide additional mana acceleration, making this Mono Red Combo deck highly explosive and aggressive.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently get powerful creatures into play from the graveyard using cards like Entomb, Reanimate, and Exhume. By discarding large creatures like Griselbrand and Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite, the deck aims to cheat them into play early in the game and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also uses disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Daze to protect its combo pieces and ensure a smooth combo execution. Ultimately, the goal is to win the game by bringing out massive threats and overpowering the opponent.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly build up infect counters on your opponent's creatures using cards like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, while protecting your own creatures with protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Spell Pierce. The deck also includes ways to quickly search for key cards with cards like Ponder and Sylvan Library. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through infect damage by utilizing efficient creatures and powerful pump spells like Berserk and Become Immense.

This deck focuses on putting early pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruptive spells like Daze, Stifle, and Force of Will. The mana denial strategy with Wasteland helps keep the opponent off balance, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder keep the deck running smoothly. True-Name Nemesis provides a hard-to-answer threat, while cards like Grim Lavamancer and Lightning Bolt provide additional removal options. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game and close out matches quickly.

The core strategy of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent using efficient and versatile creatures like Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze, Force of Will, and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features card selection and manipulation with Ponder and Brainstorm, while also utilizing efficient removal in Lightning Bolt and Dismember. The mana base is built around Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base, allowing the deck to maintain aggression and control the pace of the game.

The main idea behind this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively deploy threats like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent with cards like Daze, Force of Will, and Cabal Therapy. The deck also utilizes powerful cantrips like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Gitaxian Probe to dig for key pieces and maintain tempo. The mana base is streamlined for efficiency, with a focus on utilizing dual lands and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Lightning Bolt provides additional reach and removal, making this deck a versatile and powerful aggro option in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful land interactions and versatile removal spells. By utilizing cards like Life from the Loam to recur key lands and Punishing Fire to deal with threats, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Sylvan Library. The deck also utilizes Chalice of the Void to shut down low-cost spells, while creatures like Knight of the Reliquary provide a win condition and utility. Overall, the deck prioritizes resource management and disruption to outlast and outmaneuver opponents.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Stoneforge Mystic, supported by disruptive cards like Mother of Runes and Gaddock Teeg. The deck can quickly search for key pieces like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage using Green Sun's Zenith, while also providing removal and lifegain with Punishing Fire and Swords to Plowshares. The versatility of the deck allows it to adapt to different matchups and disrupt opponents' strategies while putting pressure on them with efficient creatures and powerful equipment.

The main concept of this control deck is to manipulate the top of the library using Sensei?s Divining Top and Counterbalance to control the opponent's spells. The deck relies on powerful card advantage engines including Brainstorm, Jace, the Mind Sculptor, and Snapcaster Mage to maintain control of the game. Terminus and Swords to Plowshares are used to remove threats from the board, while Entreat the Angels provides a win condition. The deck aims to outlast the opponent and win through attrition by controlling the game state and pacing the match to its advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells, card draw, and removal spells to keep the opponent's threats in check. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Sensei's Divining Top, Counterbalance, and Terminus, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent while also generating incremental card advantage. This deck also has a proactive win condition in Monastery Mentor, which can quickly take over the game if left unchecked. Overall, the key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain control until securing the win.
